update.description:
![filesave_schematic.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3904031974-filesave_schematic.png)

This pull request implements the file save behavior and GUI changes depicted in the above schematic (courtesy of Louise). It also provide a fix for issue 396: the building editor creates a folder with model.config and model.sdf files for a saved model, adds it to the model path, and notifies the InsertModelWidget to make the model is available in the "Insert Model" tab.

Disclaimer: There are a few known issues that I am leaving for future work:

~~1. On some computers, saving a model to the home folder causes Gazebo to crash. This happens if the hidden folder ~/.dbus is owned by root. If instructed to write to the home folder, the program will first attempt to write to .dbus, which will lead to a permission denied exception. This could be fixed by adding a try/catch block around the write, but this still does not allow the user to write models to the home folder. Suggestions for a complete fix are welcome.~~ independent of this pull request, will be solved in [PR 1329](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1329)

2. I believe the changes to FinishBuildingDialog should get merged into gui::SaveDialog and SaveDialog should be used in BuildingMaker. I am leaving this for a different pull request until after I have taken a closer look at SaveDialog.
update.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

update.description:
![filesave_schematic.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3904031974-filesave_schematic.png)

This pull request implements the file save behavior and GUI changes depicted in the above schematic (courtesy of Louise). It also provide a fix for issue 396: the building editor creates a folder with model.config and model.sdf files for a saved model, adds it to the model path, and notifies the InsertModelWidget to make the model is available in the "Insert Model" tab.

Disclaimer: There are a few known issues that I am leaving for future work:

1. On some computers, saving a model to the home folder causes Gazebo to crash. This happens if the hidden folder ~/.dbus is owned by root. If instructed to write to the home folder, the program will first attempt to write to .dbus, which will lead to a permission denied exception. This could be fixed by adding a try/catch block around the write, but this still does not allow the user to write models to the home folder. Suggestions for a complete fix are welcome.

2. I believe the changes to FinishBuildingDialog should get merged into gui::SaveDialog and SaveDialog should be used in BuildingMaker. I am leaving this for a different pull request until after I have taken a closer look at SaveDialog.
update.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

It also provide a fix for issue 396: the building editor creates a folder with model.config and model.sdf files for a saved model, adds it to the model path, and notifies the InsertModelWidget to make the model is available in the "Insert Model" tab.

Disclaimer: There are a few known issues that I am leaving for future work:

1. On some computers, saving a model to the home folder causes Gazebo to crash. This happens if the hidden folder ~/.dbus is owned by root. If instructed to write to the home folder, the program will first attempt to write to .dbus, which will lead to a permission denied exception. This could be fixed by adding a try/catch block around the write, but this still does not allow the user to write models to the home folder. Suggestions for a complete fix are welcome.

pull_request.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

update.description:
![filesave_schematic.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3904031974-filesave_schematic.png)

This pull request implements the file save behavior and GUI changes depicted in the above schematic (courtesy of Louise). It also provide a fix for issue 396: the building editor creates a folder with model.config and model.sdf files for a saved model, adds it to the model path, and notifies the InsertModelWidget to make the model is available in the "Insert Model" tab.

Disclaimer: There are a few known issues that I am leaving for future work:

1. On some computers, saving a model to the home folder causes Gazebo to crash. This happens if the hidden folder ~/.dbus is owned by root. If instructed to write to the home folder, the program will first attempt to write to .dbus, which will lead to a permission denied exception. This could be fixed by adding a try/catch block around the write, but this still does not allow the user to write models to the home folder. Suggestions for a complete fix are welcome.

2. I believe the changes to FinishBuildingDialog should get merged into gui::SaveDialog and SaveDialog should be used in BuildingMaker. I am leaving this for a different pull request until after I have taken a closer look at SaveDialog.
update.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

pull_request.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

content.raw:
Yep, that sounds like a great approach.

@chapulina, any thoughts on how to implement that? The only approach I can think of is to only generate SDF when the user saves the file. That way, when the SDF gets loaded to the physics server, it only knows about saved changes to the model and discards the rest.
content.html:
Yep, that sounds like a great approach.

@chapulina, any thoughts on how to implement that? The only approach I can think of is to only generate SDF when the user saves the file. That way, when the SDF gets loaded to the physics server, it only knows about saved changes to the model and discards the rest.

pull_request.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

content.raw:
This is what I would do if the user chooses "Don't Save, Exit":

1. If the user has *never* saved the model, the model disappears entirely. It is not placed in the scene once the editor closes. 
2. If the user at one point saved the model but now has unsaved changes, the model appears in the scene, but it's the version without the changes that were made since saving. So, everything up until the last save. 

Seem reasonable?
content.html:
This is what I would do if the user chooses "Don't Save, Exit":

  1. If the user has never saved the model, the model disappears entirely. It is not placed in the scene once the editor closes.
  2. If the user at one point saved the model but now has unsaved changes, the model appears in the scene, but it's the version without the changes that were made since saving. So, everything up until the last save.

Seem reasonable?

pull_request.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

pullrequest.title: Building Editor: Improved saving, pop-up flow, and palette buttons

content.raw:
If a user draws walls and exits without saving, should the building they drew appear in the Main Window or should it disappear?
Right now the behavior on this branch and on default is to delete the model entirely from the main window if the user chooses "Don't Save, Exit" instead of "Save". I can see how this might be frustrating.
content.html: If a user draws walls and exits without saving, should the building they drew appear in the Main Window or should it disappear? Right now the behavior on this branch and on default is to delete the model entirely from the main window if the user chooses "Don't Save, Exit" instead of "Save". I can see how this might be frustrating.
